alert.note: Alert for Davidson; Forsyth; Guilford (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 4:42PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Forsyth, northeastern Davidson and west central Guilford Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 441 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Winston-Salem, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Winston-Salem, High Point, Kernersville, Lewisville, Walkertown, Rural Hall, Stanleyville, Pfafftown, Sedge Garden and Colfax. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Dont wait until you see the first lightning flash before heading to safety. Move indoors at the first sign of threatening skies or the first sound of thunder. Deadly lightning strikes can occur well ahead of an approaching storm, prior to the arrival of rain and wind. Make sure that lightning is well away from your location before resuming outdoor activity.
